course.subject: PHYS
course.name: General Physics I
course.description: PHYS 1111 and PHYS 1112 target students who have learned the most basic knowledge in physics in high school. Students with more advanced physics background should consider taking PHYS 1312. PHYS 1111 employs an algebra-based approach. Students with knowledge of calculus should take PHYS 1112 instead. Key topics include motions and Newton's laws, work and energy, conservation of energy and momentum, rotation, rigid body, simple harmonic and damped oscillations, forced oscillations, standing waves and sound waves, kinetic theory and the laws of thermodynamics. For students under the 4-year degree only. Students with a passing grade in any MATH courses coded between 1000 and 1600 need to seek instructor’s approval for enrolling in this course.
course.prerequisites: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x OR HKDSE 1x Physics
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2, PHYS 1101, PHYS 1112, PHYS 1312

mid term前係dse野，之後野既都難難地

除左頭幾堂我有聽書之外，
我之後果d一係就做緊自己既野，

reviews.author: Bao
reviews.comment_content:
为非物理专业的人准备的基础物理课。
内容涵盖面包括运动学，力学，热力学，机械波。
因为东西很多，所以每个部分不会讲太深，只是把主要的讲一讲
reviews.comment_teaching:
instructor的英文发音还算标准，就是语速太慢，有种催眠的效果
大部分时间在念PPT，其实PPT很详细，所以后来去听课的人寥寥无几
tutor课还是蛮有用的，能复习+刷题
reviews.comment_grading:
十次assignment共占30%，基本上都是满分
期末70%，题量比较大
reviews.comment_workload: 每周一次homework，网上提交，大概十道题，但因为课上练习题很少，做题不是很熟练，所以每次大概一个半小时。每道题有六次提交机会，错一次减这道题的百分之三，所以可以忽略不计，但如果六次机会被用光，就会扣很多。所以一旦在某道题上错了几次，建议赶紧问一下其他同学。

reviews.author: stress+tension
reviews.title: Meh. Normal grade, but don't take unless you have to
reviews.comment_content:
Basic newtonian mechanics (some covered in HKDSE) and wave mechanics, basics of heat and thermodynamics.

The content and topics were quite interesting by themselves, but were completely ruined by the flat, boring and slow lecturing of the instructor.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring.

His hong kong accent is atrocious, but barely understandable, so that is not a big issue. However, his lecturing is another matter entirely.

Firstly, his lecture notes were very poorly prepared. Most slides either contained - (a) Brief explanations of concepts, which simply were not enough for comprehending the topics or (b) sample questions which were directly copied and pasted from the recommended textbooks. To be fair to the instructor, I did not attend most of the instructors as after the first few lectures, I simply was too bored to care. But self studying the powerpoint slides is simply not enough. The explanations were too brief + insufficient, and the examples did not help much with understanding. Moreover the questions were really different from the exam questions.

As for the instructor, his delivery is flat, monotonous and puts students to sleep, which is not helped by the 9 am lessons (thanks ust). He just reads out the powerpoint slides flatly without much explanation, and any explanation he gives is just so boring that I don't even give a fck anymore. He simply does not arouse my interest in physics and makes what should be a fascinating area into something more boring than Chinese literature.

For the TAs, I did not attend many of the tutorials they gave. One tutorial was just the TA showing a textbook questions, setting a 10 minute timer, and flatly reading out the answer after the 10 mins were up. From what I gathered, all other tutorials were similar so I did not attend any more of the boring tutorials.

But the most atrocious thing about this course is the masteringphysics system, which is MANDATORY for all students in the course. The system is used for completing homework and finishing the online exams. To gain access, you must purchase a 400 HKD textbook which you will never use in your life again. Apart from the frankly unreasonable price I had to pay, the system was slow, buggy and froze in the middle of the exam (which costed me several precious minutes). I honestly don't know why the instructor couldn't just use the canvas quiz system (which runs way more smoothly) to post homework + conduct exams. Guess the instructor was too lazy to come up with his own hw questions and had to rely on questions from the publisher :\

Thank god I won’t be seeing him in next semesters physics course. Avoid this course if it is taught by Cheung
reviews.comment_grading:
normal grading I guess.

Homework : 30%
Quiz : 20%
Final : 50% (no midterm)
(Some of the percentages may be wrong. Not too sure.)

Missed the quiz as I was too busy sleeping :)
Got 41/60 in the final
final grade : C
Not bad considering I missed a quiz
reviews.comment_workload:
Normal

Weekly (ish) homework on masteringphysics. you are given many attempts so it isn't too bad.

reviews.author: Argen
reviews.title: PHYS1112 Easy Version
reviews.comment_content:
Just the same as PHYS1112
About 70% of the content has already been taught in high school like, only a few topics are new like:
rotational motion, elasticity, simple harmonic motion, thermodynamics, etc.
Calculus is mentioned in lectures but will not be tested or expected. Overall they are not very difficult but might need some time to understand or digest.
The final exam paper was just like DSE exam paper.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ng tried to explain everything clearly and slowly but it seemed to be too slow. It was very easy to fall asleep in class. He is willing to answer questions.
(But I even don't know what I don't know and do know until doing the online questions)
There were some experiments after lectures, they were quite interesting and helpful to learn more.

TAs explain the ideas and concepts well. Attend tutorial if you don't understand some chapters.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not very difficult to get A range if you practice enough.
Online Assignments     30.0%
Final Exam             70.0%
No mid-term, test and quiz.
For final,
Mean = 76.63 / 142
SD = 27.15
2 pieces of cheat sheets are permitted.
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair.
8 online questions per week.
Questions of new topics require more time, but they can be finished within 3 hours on average.

reviews.author: MFYX
reviews.comment_content:
The content of the course overlapped with the high school course. The instructor taught quite slow. Only a few topics are new like: rotational motion, elasticity, simple harmonic motion, thermodynamics etc.
Motions and Newton's laws
Motion along a Straight Line
Applications of Newton's Laws
Circular Motion and Gravitation
Work and Energy
Momentum
Rotational Motion
Dynamics of Rotational Motion
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ng tried to explain everything clearly and slowly so that everyone can catch up with him but it seemed to be too slow. He tried to make everyone focused through some jokes but that doesn't work well.
TAs: WAN, Chun Yu (Peter) and ZHOU, Chengjie
The TAs are helpful and you can ask for extra practice problems and solution from the TAs.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not very difficult to get A range if you practice enough.
Online Assignments     25.0%
Mid-term            25.0%
Final Exam             50.0%
1 pieces of cheat sheet is permitted for each test.
The tutorial is quite useful and the TA will help students organize the formulas and new topics.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite Fair.
about 6-8 online questions per week.
It mainly took me about an hour finishing each week's homework.

reviews.comment_teaching: 把聲會令人好易瞓著,但上堂有啲實驗睇,教得唔錯,有心教,落早堂之後可以去問佢嘢,佢會好樂意咁答你,有試過考final之前去佢office問咗個幾鐘問題,又試過zoom問問題,好好人

reviews.comment_content: 很基础的物理内容，上半学期完全是简单版高中物理，下半学期虽然以前没学过，看过讲义就能做题了
reviews.comment_teaching: 老师是老爹爹慢悠悠讲课那种，讲得比较清楚，每次做实验翻车特别可爱
reviews.comment_grading: 期中期末考都蛮简单，可能要注意点过程书写，总体来说轻松拿A

reviews.author: Weeb101
reviews.comment_content:
Textbook used:  College Physics 10th Edition
ISBN: 9781 2921 1254 1

Motion along a Straight Line
Motion in a Plane
Newton's Law of Motion
Applications of Newton's Laws
Circular Motion and Gravitation
Work and Energy
Momentum
Rotational Motion
Dynamics of Rotational Motion

Midterm Exam

Elasticity and Periodic Motion
Mechanical Waves and Sound
Temperature and Heat
Thermal Properties of Matter
The Second Law of Thermodynamics


Although this is a non-calculus based course, Prof. Ng will mix in quite some limits, integration and vectors in this teaching.  All you need to know is the rough idea of what he is doing then you should be well-off.  That being said, I found that knowing integration can help you memorize/write down less formulae for Finals.  (Add oil in MATH 1012)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ng is a good professor when compared to others :)
He might not always explain concepts in the simplest way possible but he tries his best.  Moreover, you can always email him + cc to TAs and they reply quite quickly (in ~1 hr) or simply ask him after class.  Prof. Ng understands and speaks Cantonese, so feel free to ask him in Canto.

However, you should train yourself to be resistant to hypnosis as Prof. Ng is quite good at that.  I myself have found myself sleeping in his lecture for a handful of times... so beware of it.  


TAs: WAN, Chun Yu (Peter) and ZHOU, Chengjie
Ermmm...
I'll be frank and say I didn't think their teaching was at any point useful.  Chengjie has a heavy accent, speaks very soft and struggles to explain concepts very clearly.  When he teaches, he seems to be talking to himself rather than talking to the class.
I have never attended Peter's lessons so I won't comment on his teaching.  That being said, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say they tried their best.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%
Mid-term 25%  (1 Cheat Sheet allowed)
Finals 50%  (2 Cheat Sheet allowed)

I got near full marks in assignments, above average in MT and Finals ---> Score 84% ---> Grade A-

For reference, I got Lv 5 in DSE.
However, do note that your score in DSE does not accurately reflect anything.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 assignment per lecture.  2 lectures per week.
Doing a little bit of math, that's roughly 24 assignments in total.
All assignments are due on a fixed day (it was Thurs for us) the following week.
Each assignment consists of 3-4 textbook questions.

While each assignment doesn't seem very long, I found myself struggling with the vague wording of the textbook.  It often took me more time trying to understand the question rather than solving it.  A very poorly made textbook if you ask me.

reviews.comment_content: cover some of the secondary school physics, with extended knowlodge. totally managable. you must buy the textbook which cost you $300-400 since you need to log into pearson system to complete the homework. however, just copy and paste the exercise to google and you will find the solution

reviews.comment_grading: fair, not too good, but not too bad. if u studied physics in high school and pay effort on it. you will find it not that hard to get good grade
reviews.comment_workload: similar to math 1014/1012, regular exercise with mid term and final exam

reviews.author: MaxH
reviews.comment_content:
Before midterm: only dse mechanics stuff(from motions on a straight line to linear momentum) . If you have studied physics in high school , you should be able to handle those topics
After midterm: the content is much more difficult including rotational dynamics and thermodynamics. It will take you more time to learn and digest since I haven't learnt that before.
Do questions in textbook and familiarize yourself with the concept and question type
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecture is not that useful. The professor is reading powerpoint word by word and skip a lot of sample questions. Therefore, you wont know how to solve questions after lectures
Tutorial is better, the TA would choose some questions in the textbook as notes and teach you how to solve them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good
midterm(quiz only in mc):25%
final(much more difficult):50%
hw:25%
I get 14/15 in midterm and 74/100 in final. Overall get 84% and get a A
reviews.comment_workload:
SATISFACTORY
10 mastering physics homework and about 1 per week. spare some time for homework as some questions are quite difficult and takes time to ask somebody/think of it. You can get answers from internet .

reviews.author: Goco
reviews.title: Low workload course!!!
reviews.comment_content:
At first, is something that you have already learnt in secondary school. Actually, you need not have to attend the lecture or tutorials for the first few chapters. But after mid-term exam, things become harder and you need to pay more attention and put more effort.

• Motions along a Straight Line
• Motions in a Plane
• Newton'sLaw
• Applications of Newton's Law
• Circular Motion and Gravitation
• Work and Energy
• Momentum
• Rotational Motion
• Dynamics of Rotational Motion
• Elasticity and Periodic Motion
• Mechanical Waves and Sound
• Temperature and Heat
• Thermal Properties of Matter
• Second Law of Thermodynamics
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor follow his powerpoint for teaching. In his powerpoint, there's some questions for us to think about and he'd teach us the solutions right after he explained those questions. There were also some demonstration as well.

Personally, I don't think he teaches well during the lectures. But he did answer my enquires after lectures. He is willing to answer any questions. And most importantly, he teaches in Cantonese! If you ask him in Cantonese, he'd answer you question in Cantonese. This helps me a lot while understanding the concept behind as I'm not an English native speaker.

There is tutorial lesson every week. Mine was taught by TA Wilson Lau, some of them were taught by TA James Seo. Actually, I don't think it is so useful as math1012 tutorials. During the lessons, we just kept solving some questions. And TA would walks around to see if we need any help while encounter those problems on our owns. Then he'd tell us the answers. Literally, we only talked about two questions in every lessons! Well, he did tell us that these tutorials might be too easy for some students so we need not have to attend all tutorials and he won't take attendance also. So, is your choice to skip the tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
• Online Assignment (25%)
• Mid-term Exam (25%)
Mean: 11/15
• Final Exam (50%)
Median: 55.8/100
reviews.comment_workload: Quite low workload. Only some online assignments which those questions were chosen from the textbook.

reviews.author: Finger_ha
reviews.title: Easy version of PHYS1111
reviews.comment_content:
Content was quite easy.
opics:

Motions along a Straight Line (2)

Motions in a Plane (3)

Newton's Law (4)

Applications of Newton's Law (5)

Circular Motion and Gravitation (6)

Work and Energy (7)

Momentum (8)

Rotational Motion (9)

Dynamics of Rotational Motion (10)

Elasticity and Periodic Motion (11)

Mechanical Waves and Sound (12)

Temperature and Heat (14)

Thermal Properties of Matter (15)

Second Law of Thermodynamics (16)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching was quite interesting, not too boring and there were experiments being performed sometimes during the lectures. Two lectures would be held per week, attendance is not a compulsory thing but you if have time, why don't you attend a relax and free course.

Tutorials are offered, attendance was not compulsory so the attendance rate is usually quite low. Examples will be explained, around 3-4 questions will be discussed during the 50 minutes of time, which might be a bit time wasting for some people especially if you kind of understand the topics, as you could actually finish more than 8-10 questions in one hour of time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade course and the content is quite easy.
An easy B range could be achieved as long as you have paid some effort on the whole course.

25% Online assignment through MasteringPhysics

25% Quiz

50% Final Exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Mastering physics: ~10 assignments in total, not too heavy but do try to start working on it as soon as they are published and never wait till the last second or you will regret.

You will have 4 attempts for each question, be smart, if you won't to get higher marks, seek help from sources and yahoo answers, you could find the way to solve most of the questions in the assignments.

1 Quiz (mid- term exam) during week 7

1 final exam during final period.

reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
If you have some physics background, it won't be hard to get an A range.

If you don't major in physics (and not in engineering school), this course is a suitable choice for you.

really boring lectures
mostly doing my own stuff

exercises discussed in the tutorials is close to the question asked in the exam. and if you really dont have time, theres online copy of the tutorial noteson canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
absolute but fair grading
95% A+
90% A
85% A-

not deligent enough, got an A
i never open the textbook and finish the questions, I think I might have got an A+ if I do.
and be aware of scoring low marks in homework, it secured my A!
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is not high
all you need to do is to finish the problem set every 2 weeks

they are sometimes difficult, the mean is fairly low
But most of the time you can find answers on the internet.

reviews.author: ustiong
reviews.comment_content: the main physics topic which also covered in the DSE: Heat, wave, motion. The concepts are not too different comparing with the high school, but with a few mathemsticsl concept applied in the teaching
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Cheung has a passion to teach with powerpoint and a lot of experiments/ video demonstrations are included during lectures. But he always turn the lights into very dimmed and a lot of students are easy fall a sleep

Tutorial session: no attendance taken. The TA will pick some question from the textbook as demo. She will get some time for us to think and do by ourselves then she will write down the steps and explain further.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online assignment: around 6-10 questions, randomly picked form the textbook and you can search for calculation methods/equation/ even answers from the net.
MC Quiz: very low ( x out of 16 questions)
Final Exam: still below the mean about 1-1.2 SD
I got Level 3 in DSE Phy, but a lot of concepts and applications have been forgot already, so only get C- in this course
reviews.comment_workload:
Need to buy the textbook from the bookshop, especially for the code to register a student account for the online assignments (seem total 9  assignments in the semester) and other questions for practice.
Each question have 6 chances for answering and 3% marks will be deducted if answering a wrong answer in each trials.

also the values/details of those question will be slightly different  with the  results from the net or other classmates one.

reviews.author: zlong
reviews.comment_content: PHYS1111 targets students who have learned the most basic knowledge in physics in high school. Most of the topics has been taught in high school, which include mechanics, periodic motion, waves, and fluids, thermal dynamics. You need to buy a textbook or a code for online assignments.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ng teaches very slowly but the concepts are clearly explained in detail. At the end of the lesson, sometimes there will be TA coming in to perform experiments that are related to the content which make the concepts clearer and more understandable.
There is a revision class conducted by the TA which points out all the important things you have to study in order to prepare for the exam. There's some tips too.
Tutorial classes do help. You will do some difficult questions from the online assignment and extra practice exercises to help you familiarize yourself with the type of questions. The practice questions are quite similar to the questions in final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Assignment accounts for 30% and Final exam accounts for 70% of the final grade.
For online assignment, the mean is 24.3 / 30.
For final exam, the mean is 75.3 / 142.
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to complete online assignment every week. You can only submit at most 5 times for each answer for the online assignment. Textbook does help you to use less time to complete the online questions. Most of the question similar to the examples in the textbook.
There is no midterm exam. You can bring 2 A4 size cheat sheet to the final exam.

reviews.author: economist
reviews.title: Hard work pays off
reviews.comment_content:
Motions along a Straight Line (2) •
Motions in a Plane (3) •
Newton's Law (4) •

reviews.comment_teaching:
Bad: Actually quite boring as Dr. Cheung just read out powerpoint. Always turn off the light so I always sleep. He finishes one difficult chapter in just one lesson at last.
Good: Willing to answer you patiently when you got questions (by email/ in person); will discuss career with you <I am an only accounting student in this course>

TA is rubbish and lazy. Once I ask him questions, he just says not fair to other students if answer me.  Therefore I give him one out of five in teaching survey.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
A+ 95percent+
A 90percent+
A- 85percent+

Mid-term(1) 25%
Mastering physics 25%
Final Exam 50%
I got A with over 93%
reviews.comment_workload:
Just ok
Easy for first part(mid-term exam area) as Mostly DSE
Quite difficult for thermodynamics part especially change of internal energy as ppt not well-presented enough> try to ask your lecturer if you don't understand.

reviews.author: TH WONG
reviews.comment_content:
This course is the without-calculus version of PHYS 1112, so it is easier. A large part of the content is included in HKDSE Physics. There are new topics that aren't taught in high school, but as calculus isn't included in this course, they are just more or less of similar difficulty as DSE.

Chapters in this coures:
-Motion along a Straight Line
-Motion in a Plane
-Newton's Law of Motion
-Applications of Newton's Laws
-Circular Motion and Gravitation
-Work and Energy
-Momentum
-Rotational Motion
-Dynamics of Rotational Motion
-Elasticity and Periodic Motion
-Mechanical Waves and Sound
-Temperature and Heat
-Thermal Properties of Matter
-The Second Law of Thermodynamics
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ng is very nice, friendly and willing to answer questions from students. And he explains things clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good.

Online assignment 30%
Final 70%
[2 papers (i.e. 4 pages) of cheatsheet was allowed]

Online assignment: 29.59/30 (mean 24.3)
Final: 114.5/142 (mean 76.63, SD 27.15)
Overall 86.03%, A
reviews.comment_workload:
The only homework is the weekly online assignment. The questions aren't very difficult but they are tricky and have limited attempts, so be careful when doing them.

As there is no midterm and the content is less difficult compare to 1112, the workload should be much lighter than that of 1112.

You may also need to spend some time to make the cheatsheets before the final. The process of making the cheatsheets can also help you with the revision.

reviews.author: chrischrisyiu
reviews.title: Quite hard but good grade
reviews.comment_content: Half the content is about dse physics the other half would be new topic the power point contains many details and it is time-consuming to read the power point  better study the power point before the lecture so that you can follow the class
reviews.comment_teaching:
boring

reviews.comment_grading:
good grade  overall 67% B
Mastering physics 27.9/30
Final exam 79/142
Online assignment 30%
Final exam 70%
reviews.comment_workload:
Mastering physics each week
No midterm
Only final exam

reviews.author: yaaaaaaaa
reviews.title: PHYS 1111
reviews.comment_content: The content is very similar to PHYS 1112, but you will study less amount of chapters in this class. Mostly, you just need to recall your knowledge in physics based on what you have studied in high school. The difficulty level might be higher but it is still manageable if you study hard. For textbook, you do not need to buy the new one. There is no online quizzes or assignments.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very nice and he can easily recognize our faces. He has a good English pronunciation, easy-to-understand lecture and presentations, also really helpful if we have any question regarding his teaching materials. However, he really likes to put difficult questions for mid-term and final exam; you cannot find these questions on textbook (it is like he tries to combine the knowledge from several chapters into one question). You need to practise a lot and try to understand everything, not just remember the questions on textbook.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very good. I did not get SD for my final exam but I still got A-range mark in the end. My suggestion is that you keep your grade above the mean for midterm and final exam. The final exam will be less difficult than the midterm one, but do not rely much on final exam because i think it cannot boost-up your final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: You need to do an individual assignment each week and submit it with your notebook. Basically, for the assignment, you just have to do 10 short-essay questions from the textbook; you can choose them on your own. But sometimes, you may find it pretty boring because you need to show every single step on how you do one question. It has to be in detail, unless your grade will be deducted.

reviews.author: Sertsang
reviews.comment_content: The course is mainly about the general physics calssical part(like the Newtonia force, motion, rotation...) all the knowledge is fundamental, and at the end of semester, students may require to give a presentation in a unit of goup in front of the whole class.
reviews.comment_teaching: A good professor.
reviews.comment_grading: The overall grade is good, the mid-term is very simple, since the knowledge is the basic which you should have learnt in the high school, but the final exam is a little bit difficult, and you have to practice for it.
reviews.comment_workload: Since it is a physics course, so the workload is a little bit heavy, but you can really learn something.

Instructor上堂照讀slide,把聲好悶,但有時堂上TA會做下實驗
一開始都有上堂,之後上左幾堂自學算
reviews.comment_grading:
30% MasterPhysics (上網多數有答案,難度合理)
40% midterm   (好似大約16條,提供formula sheet)
30% Final    (58題包括:mc,short question)
reviews.comment_workload: 每星期一份MasterPhysics

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: Going through almost all the general physics topics really fast except for the electronic part which you would learn in PHYS1114
reviews.comment_content:
basic stuff of physics.
the same as what you have learnt as high school
does not contain calculus so you can survive if you have not learnt m2
reviews.comment_teaching:
i dont know the teaching since i have not attended any class
many times i just skipped it and took the course whose classroom is next to where phys 1111 is taught
reviews.comment_grading:
since i am terrible at physics i might just get a very bad grade
i am literally trash comparing to other students
i have taken the mid term exam which is the quiz
the quiz is surely very easy, it is extremely easy to get them all right since there are only 14 questions and the time given is 60 minutes
the final exam is online mode and there are 58 questions which should be done in 2 hours, the time is more than sufficient because the questions are pretty easy and the exam is open book. the questions are even more simple than the homework.
the results of the final exam came out, the mean is 56 and the sd is 20, i personally got 90.43/100 in the final exam
the grade has not come out yet tho.
The grade just came out, it is an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
the online work system is just garbage
i have not got one single homework all right
one time i even got a score less than 99% because of the rounding, the score is insanely unreasonable and i cannot change it since once you made a mistake your mark gets lower and it keeps getting lower if you try many times
the system is just unbearable and i am really angry
i personally got 88.9/90 for the homework section. i just cannot believe that every time there are students who got full mark in the homework under this masteringphysics system... many times i just got really mad because of my rounding error and every time i google i just cannot afford to see theanswers on Chegg because i am just too poor for buying an account... makes me really saaaaaad

reviews.author: Pow
reviews.comment_content: The course is mainly about the general physics calssical part(like the Newtonia force, motion, rotation...) all the knowledge is fundamental, and at the end of semester, students may require to give a presentation in a unit of goup in front of the whole class.
reviews.comment_teaching: A good professor.
reviews.comment_grading: The overall grade is good, the mid-term is very simple, since the knowledge is the basic which you should have learnt in the high school, but the final exam is a little bit difficult, and you have to practice for it.
reviews.comment_workload: Since it is a physics course, so the workload is a little bit heavy, but you can really learn something.

reviews.author: lmacchch
reviews.title: Not easy to get A+ even for NDS
reviews.comment_content:
Before the midterm, the coverage of this lesson is almost all the things that I have learned in the high school of mainland China.
However, after the midterm, the content became extremely difficult and all the coverage was university level, Therefore, don't be cheated by the contents before midterm
reviews.comment_teaching: Even though I only listened to a few lectures taught be CHEUNG, I have to say in my opinion, his teaching is in fact quite satisfactory. I think his teaching is a very standard teaching method for science study, although his English has accent.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not so good as my imagination, extremely difficult to get A+. The A+ cut off for this year is 93.
grading: 25% hw, 25% midterm, 50% final
I got 98% in hw(in fact, according to this year's hw grading policy, it's quite easy to get a high grade), 12/12 in midterm (mean is around 7-8), 26/32 in final(mean is around 16) and overall around 90 and I finally got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Only the pearson mastering physics, once a week, and approximately 2 hours each.

reviews.author: Abb
reviews.comment_content: Before midterm, the content covers things we learned in high school. After midterm, the content becomes difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor kept reading PPTs and I really cannot understand his heavy accent. So I skip half of his classes.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not very good. A mean score will get B~B+. 1.5~2SD will guarantee an A/A+. If you want to get a high grade, you need to do more extra exercise.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. You just need to do the HW once a week. But if you want to get a high score, you have to pay some effort.

reviews.author: Meredith
reviews.title: 高考选物理的同学可以考虑
reviews.comment_content:
覆盖半本college physics的章节，书需要购买。
高考生60%的内容之前有过学习，会相对轻松。期中之前的章节基本都学过，期中之后新知识点较多。
考试都会有公式表提供，期中之后涉及的公式较多，但熟练应用即可，无需背出。
内容涉及声学，力学，热学。
reviews.comment_teaching:
教授英语不是很流畅。
本人没怎么上他的课and回放声音不是很清晰，主要看书自学，但效果不比听他课差。
上课进度偏快，更像是照念书上公式例题。
期末考前会发每一章的Pearson练习题，对于复习很有帮助。
reviews.comment_grading:
25%线上作业（Online assignment）
25%期中（quiz）覆盖章节2-7
50%期末（exam）覆盖章节8-12，14-16，期中之前章节内容不再考察

本人
online assignment 98.65%
quiz 11/12 mean=7.6 median=8 sd=2.7
exam 27/32 median=16 sd=5.6
overall 89.77%
grade A

minimum overall for A+ is 93%
reviews.comment_workload:
完成7次线上作业，每次作业大概15题。
workload不大。
好好做作业，每次输入答案错误都会降低每次作业的成绩，选择题一定要慎重（如果是Pearson的话）
作业能帮助你熟悉知识点。
